theoryTitle: Bon Clay as an Honorary Straw Hat Member
theoryText: Many fans theorize that Bon Clay should be considered an honorary member of the Straw Hat Pirates due to his unwavering loyalty to Luffy and his multiple life-threatening sacrifices. The theory suggests that while he may never officially join the crew, his bond with Luffy is as strong as any crew member's, demonstrated through his actions during the Alabasta and Impel Down arcs.
proposedBy: Multiple One Piece fans across Reddit, Tumblr, and forums

source.title: One Piece Season 2 Can Introduce My Favorite Honorary Straw Hat

supportingEvidence: Bon Clay sacrificed himself twice to save Luffy and the Straw Hats
He helped Luffy navigate through Impel Down's dangerous levels
He carried a dying Luffy to Ivankov, saving his life
Luffy remembers him fondly and considers him a true friend
counterEvidence: Bon Clay chose to remain in Impel Down as the new Queen of Newkama Land
He has his own purpose and community in Level 5.5
Oda has never indicated Bon Clay would join the crew
The crew roster is already established and complete

theoryTitle: Bon Clay's Return to Help Luffy in Future Arcs
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Bon Clay, who survived and became the new Queen of Newkama Land in Impel Down, will eventually escape or be freed and return to help Luffy during a critical moment in the final war or endgame of One Piece. The theory suggests Oda wouldn't keep him alive without a purpose for his character's return.

source.title: Sorry One Piece Fans, Bon Clay Is Never Joining the Straw Hats

supportingEvidence: Bon Clay is confirmed alive in Impel Down as shown in cover stories
Oda has a pattern of bringing back beloved characters for important moments
Bon Clay's friendship with Luffy is one of the series' most powerful bonds
The Revolutionary Army has connections to Impel Down through Ivankov
counterEvidence: Bon Clay has found happiness and purpose as Queen of Newkama Land
His story arc feels complete with his sacrifice and new role
Luffy doesn't know he survived, which might be intentional
Not all characters need to return for the story to be satisfying

theoryTitle: The 'Swans Never Die' Philosophy Foreshadows Bon Clay's Importance
theoryText: Fans theorize that Bon Clay's repeated use of the phrase 'Swans never die' and his multiple survivals after apparent death are foreshadowing his crucial role in the series' endgame. The theory suggests his resilience and loyalty represent a thematic element Oda will revisit when Luffy needs his friends most.

source.title: 10 Times Bon Clay Proved He Was Luffy's Best Friend

supportingEvidence: Bon Clay has 'died' or been left behind twice but survived both times
The swan motif is consistently emphasized in his character design and dialogue
His friendship with Luffy is repeatedly highlighted as genuine and unbreakable
Oda tends to reward loyal characters with important roles
counterEvidence: The phrase could simply be character flavor rather than foreshadowing
Some character arcs are complete without additional appearances
Bon Clay's current status as Queen of Newkama Land seems like a fitting conclusion

theoryTitle: Ivankov and Bon Clay Connection Was Planned from Alabasta
theoryText: Fans theorize that Eiichiro Oda had already planned the connection between Bon Clay and Emporio Ivankov during the Alabasta arc, given Bon Clay's okama character traits and fighting style. The reunion in Episode 432 and Bon Clay's mission to find Ivankov represents long-term storytelling where Oda planted seeds for the Impel Down arc years in advance.

source.title: One Piece: 5 Ways Ivankov Was The Hero Of Impel Down (& 5 It Was Bon Clay)

supportingEvidence: Bon Clay's okama traits perfectly align with Ivankov's Kamabakka Kingdom
Oda is known for planning story elements years in advance
Bon Clay's specific mention of seeking Ivankov feels too convenient to be unplanned
The thematic connection between the two characters is strong
counterEvidence: Oda has stated he doesn't plan everything years ahead
The connection could have been made during planning for Impel Down arc
Some narrative connections emerge naturally as the story develops
